ygData.subject: Why is there no "item" link relation registered at IANA?
ygData.msgSnippet: I just wondered why there is no item relation (ore something similar) registered at [1] with the semantics of this is an item of this collection resource .

Subject: Why is there no "item" link relation registered at IANA?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=214300837; y=h4qidrzn1_F1G8rwt_b6WO-DguoZqMszYBZ-hrUvtkj4_fINLg_Y

I just wondered why there is no "item" relation (ore something similar) reg=
istered at [1] with the semantics of "this is an item of this collection re=
source". There is one e.g. for the first item (start). I=B4ve seen some exa=
mples around the web - recently [2] - using a proprietary "item" relation.
=

I would like to register this relation, but i could not see any link to th=
e registration form/procedure. Furthermore, i don=B4t know if a registratio=
n would be accepted without "item" being a part of some RFC (like all the o=
ther relation types in the registry...)

The use case for this is: you coul=
d return a collection of links instead of embedded resources for a "collect=
ion resource".

[1] http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-rel=
ations.xml
[2] http://stateless.co/hal_specification.html#examples
